notes: Hides under the shades of leaves.
Moves quite fast, hard to take good images.
Moves quite fast, not sure if it can fly.
Such a common ant around here. Can give a nasty bite!
So hard to spot on the ground, such a good camouflage.
I have taken way better pictures of this in the past, but we go with this for now. Dude can hop!
It has distinctive heart-shaped abdomen!
It is a weevil!
My first spider in the patch!
very tiny bug, I am not sure of the specific species yet.
Very tiny fly. Had to hold my breath for a long time to get a steady shot.
I like spiders.
I like crickets. They can sit still for a long time.
He is dead, Jim.
Blends very well on the grass, and it hops!
Small, shiny bug
Fairly small fly.
Dude would not stop moving, but moves very predictable on each blade of the grass as if it is doing some survey. Cool movement.
Small hopper. It sat still for a while under some shade. Must invest in a flash.
After many attempts of blurry images due to low light, when I just about to get a good pic, an ant showed up and scared this moth away.
This one stood still enough to get a okayish record shot, but had to bump up the ISO for a faster shutter. Noisy pic.
Very common. Hard to spot unless they move.
I like these ones. They sit still!
Tiny, but very shiny. ~ 1.5 mm in length.
Small fly, ~ 2mm in length
Its head looks like a tiny helment!. Small in size, ~2 mm in length may be.
Small, very pretty patterns that I only found out after zooming into the photo. ~ 2mm in lenth
Biggest insect yet!
Very small. No idea what species it is. Casually took the photo of the flower, and was surpised to see the life moving on it!
Oh to be a fly on the grass...
I saw a blob of cotton walking around! Reminded me of Howl's castle. Cool bug!
This is a new one. Never seen these before. Come to think of it, never paid attention to aphids as much.
I casually took the picture of the flower, only to see the tiniest of the spiders! Very gool guy. He was quite busy.
Green, shiny, sits still.
What a kill! Lynx spiders don't web, they just attack!
This time it is carrying trash! Also known as trash bug.
Look at the details on it. It is very small, hard to spot.
Crickets are cool, they sit still.
Not very sure of the identification. I think I have done many mistakes already. This one looks like a mosquito, but bee apparently. How.
This one allowed me click just 2 photos, lucky me.
What is with these metallic green shiny bugs! Quite a few around here.
This one allowed me take a quite a few snaps. Eventually landed where in the sunshine!
Not sure of the identification. I couldn't get more than one angle of this.
So tiny! like about 1.2 mm may be. I am not sure of the ID.

At first, I fell for it. I thought it is the carpenter ant. But it wasn't moving around, unlike the other ants near by. Hah! It figured the mimicking part really well, but didn't copy the behaviour. I got him!
It has funny walk. Keeps flapping its wings every few steps.
Dame is here! What a beauty!
Like many ants in the patch, this kept moving along each grass blade, leaves. Tiny one.
insect
Communication, ant style.
I am so not sure what species, family, order, etc etc.
Very small, looks like a tiny twig.
These are very small. Takes a lot of patience.
This one has fuzzy texture. For a while I thought picture is getting out of focus. Nope!
Big for a fly. Looks quite intimidating!
This one just collected as much pollen as possible! Tiny though, perhaps 3-4 mm in length.
It is a weevil!
These are small, but can you give you a neat bite.
Good looking ant! It stood still for a while, allowing me some good photos.
They are always upside down for some reason.
It can not stand still! Keeps moving its hands every second!
I was wondering when will a mosquito appear. Here it is.
I wonder what it is doing in the patch.
Is it an ant? Is it a beetle? Oh man.
It just wouldn't sit on the flower. Just kept moving up and down, nonstop.
Just a fly.
Tiny, but shiny!
Looks like a leafhopper alright!
Just wouldn't step in to the sun, kept hiding under the leaves. Took a lot of moving around to take a pic.
About 3mm long, it sat still, but I couldn't get a neat picture because of my skill issues.
It has some patterns on its back, should try to get a clear pic next time.
Such a neat ant! It has golden butt!
Very small spider with fairly large kill!
I didn't get a lot of time to get a better pic. Pretty big kill!
Very small, very small. Just wouldn't stop moving!
Haha, I get it now! It can hover at a fixed point really well.
Guess what, it did stay quite stable. Did not move for a long time!
It is their courting dance. They dance, do the tango then do little smooch!
About 3 mm. Light was fading quite fast, I couldn't get better pics.
They haul quite a lot of trash, as such!
Lady is here, people! Ain't it pretty!
What a little jewel, gave some sufficient time to take photos.
Very tiny being. Camera just refused to auto-focus.
Looks very similar to common housefly. But the AI says it ain't. Hail the algorithms!
For a tiny bug, we definitely gave a really long name.
Another type of fruitfly, that does not eat any fruits.
They and snails are not good friends. Infact they might be enemies.
Shiny, big and happy to sit still!
First butterfly to spot on the patch!
Very curious animal!
Very shiny, can sit still! I like bugs that have good contrast colors, they are easy to photograph!
Had only few seconds to shoot pics before it flew away, better pics next time!
What a weevil!
Yet another type of fly!
Yet antother fly! Man. One too many around here.
Wow! I learnt new today! The cute ladybird larva is not so cute! It looks like it can sting!
Small, shiny. Many such around here.
Shiny! Finally, I got a decent-ish shot of this one.
It looks like an inspiration for the alien design. It looks very well built!
Cool bug. Gave me about 30 seconds to click few decent pics.
Very small, looked just like a small black thing. Hard to see features unless looked closer.
This one is really good at hide and seek game. Every time I moved, it hid under the leaves.
I had the camera in wrong set up / mode and didn't notice until the bug moved away. Rookie mistake.
Cool bug, with eyes that match the body!
They simply won't sit still. This one gave me exact 1.5 seconds to take pics.
Cool bug. They seem fairly common around here.
Woohoo! First frog on the patch!! I love frogs.
Night photography. I have a long way to go to learn this art.
I really like this shot. A spot of red amongst the sea of green.
I am not sure of the species though. It is a wolf spider family, but can't be sure of the exact species.
This one is new for me. I have seen similar on with red and black color during the day.
This one took a lot of effort to take any decent picture. It kept moving in and around the undergrowth, never surfaced onto clear area.
Shot early-ish morning, not enough light to capture the details of this tiny fellow.

Very funky spider. This one is mimicing Tetraponera rufonigra, a very similar colored ant with a very painful bite. I actually fell for it. Only after the first few  pictures, did I notice the spider features.
Argh. Not enough light even at 4 PM. Grainy images, and horrible photography skills.
Bot fly. What eles can I say?
Dance fly, dance!
Nice one, I like the patterns on it.
Blue-ish black and very shiny. I had to use all my photography tricks in the bag to get these pics. I need to learn more tricks.
Late night bug hunting. No fun.
Woah. Tiny. I think I was this close to a complete blank mind when I noticed this. This is true meditation.
A very small thing, was hard to get sharper pics.
Tiny black fly. I do not know how to photograph tiny things. Ugh.
